info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 20 at 2:52PM PST until December 23 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 4000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 12 inches possible with localized amounts up to 24 inches over higher remote terrain. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph over exposed terrain. * WHERE...Elevations above 4000 feet in Western Siskiyou County and Central Siskiyou County. This includes Etna Summit on Sawyers Bar Rd. * WHEN...From late Tuesday night through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Stock emergency kit with tire chains, flashlight, batteries, blankets, food, water, and medications. * Plan now to avoid traveling during the storm. * A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant snow accumulations that may create dangerous travel.
